channel.title: CyberNetSec - Latest Cybersecurity Articles
channel.description: Latest cybersecurity threat intelligence articles from the past 3 days

item.title: Google Patches 6th Actively Exploited Chrome Zero-Day of 2025
item.description:
Google has issued an emergency security update for its Chrome web browser to address CVE-2025-10585, a high-severity type confusion vulnerability in the V8 JavaScript engine. This marks the sixth time in 2025 that Google has patched a Chrome zero-day vulnerability that was being actively exploited i...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Agenda Ransomware Evolves, Hits Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
The Agenda ransomware group, also known as Qilin, is escalating its attacks by targeting critical infrastructure sectors with evolved tactics. According to research from Trend Micro, the ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) operation is using a cross-platform approach, abusing legitimate remote management...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: Tengu Ransomware Hits Brazilian Education Provider
item.description:
The Tengu ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against UniCursos, a prominent education provider in Brazil. The attack, which was posted to the group's leak site on October 23, 2025, follows the common double-extortion model, where the attackers threaten to publish sensitive...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Hits Jewett-Cameron, Steals Financial Data
item.description:
Jewett-Cameron, an Oregon-based manufacturing and distribution company, has confirmed in an SEC filing that it suffered a ransomware attack on October 15, 2025. The attack caused significant disruption to its business operations and resulted in the theft of sensitive corporate data. The exfiltrated ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Lawsuit Hits SC School District After Ransomware Breach
item.description:
South Carolina's Lexington-Richland School District 5 (LR5) is facing a class-action lawsuit following a ransomware attack in June 2025 that exposed the personally identifiable information (PII) of over 31,000 students, staff, and alumni. The lawsuit alleges that the school district was negligent in...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: Lazarus Group's 'Operation DreamJob' Targets EU Drone-Makers
item.description:
The notorious North Korea-linked APT group, Lazarus, is conducting a cyber-espionage campaign dubbed 'Operation DreamJob' targeting European defense and aerospace companies. The campaign specifically focuses on firms involved in Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) technology. The attackers use sophisticat...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: NY Regulator Puts Financial Firms on Notice: You Are Accountable for Your Vendors' Security
item.description:
The New York State Department of Financial Services (DFS) has issued new guidance for financial institutions, emphasizing their ultimate accountability for managing cybersecurity risks originating from third-party service providers (TPSPs). The regulator warned that as firms increasingly rely on clo...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Unit 42 Exposes 'Smishing Deluge' from China and 'Jingle Thief' Gift Card Fraud
item.description:
Researchers at Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42 have detailed two distinct and significant cybercrime operations. The first, a massive smishing campaign dubbed 'The Smishing Deluge,' is attributed to a China-based threat actor and is flooding mobile users globally with malicious SMS messages. The second ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Threat Intelligence, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Healthcare Breaches Seem to Drop, But Government Shutdown Hides True Numbers
item.description:
Official data for September 2025 shows only 26 major healthcare data breaches, the lowest monthly total since 2018. However, The HIPAA Journal cautions that this apparent decline is misleading. A US government shutdown has largely halted the HHS's Office for Civil Rights (OCR) from processing and up...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Palomar Health Breach Exposes Highly Sensitive Patient Data, Including Biometrics
item.description:
Palomar Health Medical Group (PHMG), a California-based healthcare provider, has announced it was the victim of a cybersecurity incident that exposed sensitive patient data. The compromised information includes not only names and personal identifiers but also highly sensitive data types such as biom...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Orders Federal Agencies to Patch New Actively Exploited Vulnerability
item.description:
On October 22, 2025, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) added a new, unspecified vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. This action confirms that the flaw is being actively exploited in the wild by malicious actors. Under Binding Operational...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical Netty Zero-Day Bypasses All Major Email Authentication
item.description:
A critical zero-day vulnerability, CVE-2025-59419, has been discovered in the widely used Netty Java library, affecting countless applications that handle email. The flaw allows an unauthenticated attacker to perform SMTP injection by embedding carriage return and line feed characters into email com...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Phishing, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Iran's MuddyWater APT Targets 100+ Governments with Phoenix Backdoor
item.description:
The Iranian state-sponsored threat group MuddyWater is conducting a large-scale cyber-espionage campaign targeting over 100 government entities, primarily in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA). According to Group-IB, the attackers are using phishing emails sent from a compromised mailbox, lever...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: Patch Now: Critical RCE Flaws in Oracle E-Business Suite Marketing Module
item.description:
Oracle has issued urgent patches for two critical, unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities in its E-Business Suite. The flaws, CVE-2025-53072 and CVE-2025-62481, both carry a CVSS score of 9.8 and affect the Oracle Marketing module. An attacker with network access can exploit the...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Pwn2Own Day 1: Hackers Net $522K for 34 Zero-Days in SOHO Devices
item.description:
The first day of Trend Micro's Pwn2Own Ireland 2025 competition was a resounding success for security researchers, who earned a total of $522,500 for demonstrating 34 unique zero-day vulnerabilities. In a stunning display, every single one of the 17 scheduled attempts against popular SOHO devices—in...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, IoT Security, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →
